source_sentence: 旹元祿八乙亥臘月初吉總之下州飰高玅雲山法輪講寺住學之僧如海謹誌金光明經照解卷上(并序)四明石芝沙門　宗曉　述敘曰斯經雖部屬方等非醍醐比而受持者眾乃與法華侔盛但梵夾東來備歷諸朝翻譯而經五師及中間合六本不同今世所傳即北涼曇無讖師所譯最為舊物奈何而在藏外別行先賢不曉部類之異多將合本改足讖譯或累經傳寫魚魯成訛遂致在處板籍有異至於脫文長句者有之言乖字異者有之本既不純取捨莫準往往披誦之人眯目其間者多矣愚今謹案歷代翻經目錄先示前後部帙次述台宗釋經五章三分諸品生起然後研詳龍藏合本考覈人世別行斷以天台文句為指南復用諸家義記作輔翼所有異同訛謬一皆刊正為為句讀事相餘疑從而披剝繫以境觀修顯俾夫人人發揮本有大光明藏遠於如貧數寶之譏矣十科既成列上下卷舒題曰金光明經照解噫爝火之微烏足以佐日月之騰煇而大教炳然容光必照故區區鄙志莫得而隱云也。

source_sentence: 旹大宋紹熈庚戌歲紀履長之旦比丘宗曉謹序一翻譯部帙二五章大旨三三分分文四諸品生起五辨正訛謬六為為音訓七點示句讀八箋釋事相九簡擇餘疑十境觀修顯○一翻譯部帙夫翻譯者學佛之喉衿釋義之元首也良以吾佛誕生迦維衛國設教滿于五天五天語言書體皆本乎劫初光音梵天下生為人種時作乃與此土蒼頡所造之字不同故須梵僧持來一一易成華言方堪講誦流衍如昔三朝僧史十科選佛竝以翻譯冠首亦此意耳茲經梵本是一此土或翻或合乃有六本。
translation: The second five chapters are the main idea, the third three parts of the text, the fourth section on the production of various texts, the fifth section on correcting errors, the sixth section on phonemes and lectures, the seventh section on indicating phrases and reading, the eighth section on explaining phenomena and the ninth section on investigating remaining doubts, and the tenth section on contemplating objects and cultivating expressions.

source_sentence: 一中天竺沙門曇無讖師於北涼沮渠蒙遜朝玄始年中翻譯一部四卷成文一十八品題曰金光明經靖邁譯經圖紀云讖師翻譯之時甞言此經篇品未足此即最初古譯舊經今世所行之本也。
translation: First, the ascetic Dharmakṣema of Central India translated a four-fascicle work in the middle of the Xuanzhi era of the Juqu Mengxun dynasty of Northern Liang into a text of 18 chapters titled Jin guangming jing Jingmai jingtuji, which says that when he translated it, the ascetic said that the chapters of the sūtra were not sufficient.

source_sentence: 二中天竺沙門耶舍崛多此翻稱藏同闍那崛多於後周武帝朝譯一部五卷號金光明更廣壽量大辯陀羅尼經智昇釋教錄云此五卷經非是全譯但於讖本續加壽量品大辯天品也。
translation: Second, the Zhongtianzhushi ascetic Yeshe Horta, who translates this sutra as a tripiṭaka, translated a five-fascicle work in the reign of Emperor Wu of the latter Zhou Dynasty, which was called the Golden Light Sutra of Extensive Life Span and Great eloquence Dhāraṇī, as recorded in Zhisheng's Record of the Explanation of the Teaching.

source_sentence: 三西天竺沙門波羅末陀此翻真諦奉梁武帝詔於大清元年譯一部七卷二十二品號金光明帝王經南山內典錄云此本於讖譯全加四品謂三身分別品業障滅品陀羅尼最淨地品依空滿願品以此四品足讖本十八成二十二品也。
translation: Third, the monk Paramârtha of Western India translated this version of the True Truth in response to Emperor Wu's imperial edict in the first year of the Qing dynasty, translating a seven-fascicle, twenty-two-part sūtra titled Jin guangming diaowang jing Nanshannei jianlu, which said that this version had all four parts added to the translation, namely, the three identity-specific parts, the karmic hindrances cessation part, the dhāraṇī, the purest ground part, and the reliance on emptiness to fulfill the vows part. These four parts were sufficient for the eighteen parts of the original sūtra, which became twenty-two parts.

source_sentence: 四北天竺沙門闍那崛多此翻志德同達磨笈多於大隋開皇十七年譯一卷號金光明銀主陀羅尼品付囑品釋教錄云讖師真諦崛多三師所譯竝無此二品德師撿挍梵本有之是故譯出。
translation: Fourth, in northern India, the ascetic Ārya Horta, who translates this translation, was likewise translated by Dharmagupta into a single volume titled Dhāraṇī Chapter of Golden Light and Silver Lord and entrusted with the Chapter of the Transmission of the Teaching, which was recorded in the Record of the Teaching as being lacking in the translations of the three masters, namely, Fashi, Zenith, Horta, and Deity, who examined the Sanskrit version and therefore translated it out.

source_sentence: 五大隋大興善寺沙門寶貴於開皇十七年覽前四譯其文重疊即以讖譯為本旁採諸譯芟繁補闕合成一部八卷其時獨留此本入藏餘本重者竝已削去故釋教錄云貴師以讖本十八品耶舍續壽量品大辯天品真諦所譯四品志德所譯二品總二十四品八卷成文號合部金光明經自序云此經翻譯已足。
translation: In the seventeenth year of the Kaihuang reign, the five Śrāmaṇeras of Daxingshan Temple took the previous four translations and overlapped their texts, so he used them as the source, partially sliced down the complicated ones and filled in the gaps, and synthesized them into one eight-fascicle work.

source_sentence: 六大唐齊州沙門義淨親往五天證聖元年迴歸河洛奉則天皇帝勅譯出一部十卷三十一品題曰金光明最勝王經此經比前諸譯文相稍廣探賾其意亦大同小異耳。
translation: Six years later, the Qizhou ascetic Yijing from Datang went to the five heavens, returned to Heluo in the first year of Zhengsheng, and was commanded by Emperor Zetian to translate a ten-fascicle, thirty-one chapter sutra titled Jin guangming zuishengwang jing.

source_sentence: 以上六本但是五譯以合部非翻梵故於今之世則存三本據湖福大藏俱存二本一者合部在化字函二者最勝王經在場字函雖只二本實具五譯以合部通收諸品故三者藏外別行本即今所解古譯讖經故天竺台教目錄云北涼讖譯金光明經四卷別行於世未曾入藏是也。
translation: The above six texts are only five translations because the combined text is not a translation of the Sanskrit, so three texts exist in the present day, and according to the Hofuku Tripiṭaka, two texts exist: one, the combined text is in the letter Huazi; two, the Sutra of the Most Excellent King is in the letter Chang; although there are only two texts, there are really five translations because the combined text includes all the grades; and three, the texts outside the Tripiṭaka are special translations of the ancient scriptures that are now being interpreted, so the Tianzhu Taijiao Catalogue says that the four-fascicle Golden Light Sutra of the Northern Liang Translation has been published separately and has never been admitted to the Tripiṭaka.

source_sentence: 或曰藏中既有諸譯於世何故唯講誦讖經耶今以二義伸之一智者闡化陳隋開皇十七年歸寂不見唐譯亦應未睹合部所以唯講讖經者諒於諸譯義有所適莫焉二此經始自北涼迄今千有餘載披誦之盛感驗惟多得非讖譯上冥佛意下契機緣乎故北山神清曰北涼微國也觀乎聖師無讖宣譯其國非小如楚書曰楚國無寶唯善是寶斯言愚竊韙之。
translation: Some people say that there are many translations in the collection in the world, why is the only one that recites the scriptures? Now, let's take two meanings and explain them. One is that the wise man who explained the Chan Sui Kaihuang 17 years ago retired and didn't see the Tang translation, so the only one who recites the scriptures is the one who understands that the meanings of the translations are appropriate. Two, this scripture began in Northern Liang and has been recited for more than a thousand years.

source_sentence: 天台智者國師悟旋總持宏演法華三部雄詮判釋一代聖教而於諸經雖不委悉別消若其通論大小偏圓權實之旨義亦盡矣而幸此經師甞別講玄疏流行故今解釋經題略括彼文以為學者聞思之本云爾。
translation: Although the scriptures are not fully and separately eliminated, the general theory of large and small, partial and perfect, expedient and true, and their meaning is exhausted, it is fortunate that the master of this scripture has separately taught the popular commentary on the Profound Commentary.

source_sentence: 玄序曰此金光明甚深無量雖太虗空界尚不喻其高廣豈山斤海滴寧得盡其邊涯是諸佛所游過菩薩所行以金為名名葢眾寶之上以法性為體義則如來所游莊嚴菩薩深玅功德以為宗照曜諸天心生歡喜以為用文號經王教攝眾典常為四方四佛之所護持三世十方亦復如是一切菩薩徧佗方以遙禮四鎮天王親雨淚以稱揚諸天覆之以天威地神潤之以地肥大辯加之以智慧功德益之以珍財若有聞者則能思惟無上微玅甚深之義開甘露門入甘露城令諸眾生食甘露味以智慧刀裂煩惱網三塗除惱熱諸有悉乾枯舉要言之一切世間未曾有事悉具出現敢託斯義輒欲興言冀涓滴入海禽鳥向山實藉片緣同均鹹色也欲觀斯經首題五重玄義。
translation: The preface to the Xuan says, "This golden light is so profound and limitless that even though it's too vast for the realm of space, it doesn't measure up to its height and breadth, how could a drop from a mountain catty ocean even exhaust its limit? It's a name given to all the buddhas who travel past what the bodhisattvas do.

source_sentence: 一金光明為名又五一示通別佛說諸經皆是文字是通金光明三字是別逗化所以不同故二明翻譯梵語修跋拏此翻金婆頗婆此翻光鬱多摩此翻明修多羅此翻經三約譬喻古師以金光明三字譬三德或譬三三天台廣破之然後自約處中十種三法以釋三字所謂道識性般若菩提大乘身涅槃三寶德此之十法該括始終義含逆順橫竪徧譬一切三法方稱無量甚深法性之旨四依經立名上來舉譬多是義推依文立題方為親切故序云是金光明諸經之王創首標名彌為可用五當體受稱法性可尊可貴名金寂而常照名光大悲能多利益名明即是金光明當體法門非借世金以譬法也問舊云此經從譬得名云何矯異而依文耶答非今就文而害於譬若苟執譬復害於文義有二途應須兩存若鈍根人以譬擬法若利根人即法作譬下文云即於是典金光明中而得見我又云為鈍根故起大悲心鈍人守株守指利人不須株指(上竝玄文)。

source_sentence: 如上天台五義釋名先達案七種立題判其所歸多云單譬斷奠此經單法為名而不失譬喻釋者唯四明法師也故拾遺記曰應知此經三字別題是法非譬經敘如來游於無量甚深法性乃住此定而便唱云是金炎明諸經之王豈非直指法性名金光明不云法性如金光明而下文所立譬喻一釋葢以諸師解金光明為世物象其實不知法相圓融大師欲示金光明海諸法融備故順諸師以三字譬具足比況十種三法格佗譬法不周然雖順佗以譬顯法其如經題是法非譬故後自立附文當體二釋斥彼義推譬喻疎遠依經就法方為親切或議四明單法定題得何意趣今謂拾遺深領玄文縱奪之旨所謂天台先縱古師約義廣演譬喻格佗譬法不周次則奪歸附文當體單法定題依文親近也。
translation: As explained in the above commentary on the five interpretations of the name of Tiantai, the first penetrates into the case of the seven kinds of titles that are judged to be mostly single-parable, cutting off the dilemma that the only person who interprets this sūtra with a single dharma title without losing the parable is the Dharma teacher Siming. Therefore, the sequential commentary says that you should know that the three separate titles of this sūtra are dharmas and not parables, and the sūtra describes the Tathāgata's travels through the innumerable and exceedingly profound nature of dharmas, abiding in this concentration and then singing, "This is the king of the scriptures," doesn't it directly refer to the nature of dharmas as the name Golden Light, not as the nature of dharmas as Golden Light and the parables that are posited below?

source_sentence: 二法性為體體是一經之主質也此經若依義則以法身為體若依文則以法性為體法性語通今以佛所游入法性為體也此體種種眾行而歸趣之類眾星之環北辰如萬流之宗東海故以法性為此經之正體當知體禮之釋與經法性意同如來之所游是貴極之法故復次體是底義得此體者窮源極底故復次體是達義得此體者通達一切異名別說故。
translation: Second, the essence of the Dharma-nature is the main essence of the sutra. If this sutra relies on the meaning, then the Dharma-body is the essence; if it relies on the text, then the Dharma-nature is the essence; the Dharma-nature is the linguistic penetration; now, the Dharma-nature is the essence of the Buddha's journey into the Dharma-nature; this essence is the variety of practices and the types of destinations to which they all return, such as the ring of stars in the North Star and the ten thousand streams in the East Sea.

source_sentence: 三三身常果為宗宗者要也此經專用佛果為宗要良由法性甚深微玅若欲顯之非果不克當知果是顯體之樞要如提綱則目整也經云釋迦如來所得壽命釋迦是果人壽量是果法果人克果法冥乎法性四佛斷疑舉山斤等無能知其數量明其能常八十是無常其常尚不能知焉能知其非常非無常若不約果佛此義難明故以三身常果為此經之宗要也。
translation: The three constant fruits of the three bodies are the tenets of the tenets of the doctrine, and this sūtra is dedicated to the Buddha's fruits as the tenets.

source_sentence: 四滅惡生善為用用謂力用也此經滅惡故言力生善故言用此且偏舉耳苦是惡果三毒是惡因惡因不除苦果不謝聖人先令滅惡因故懺悔品居先樂是善果懺讚是善因惡滅善生故讚歎品居後但懺悔品滅惡非不生善讚歎品生善非不滅惡空品則導成滅惡生善四王已下護經流通竝是生善滅惡是故此經以滅惡生善為力用也。
translation: The sūtra's purpose of cessation of evil and producing goodness is to use what's meant by power. This sūtra says power because it cessates evil, and it says use because it produces goodness. Suffering is the result of evil, and the three poisons are the causes of evil.

source_sentence: 五方等生酥為教相教是聖人被下之言相謂分別同異論此經之教相若安般若而時異若入會三而味別案經云有一比丘讀誦大乘方等經典既言方等豈非文耶方等之教通於三乘人修如此則五味明義當第三生酥味攝四藏明義則雜藏收四教明義則當通教通教之中即得論於帶別明圓也疏釋已廣說空云此經屬方等後分乃指般若為已廣說空今云方等者結集經家以氣類相同向前集之也。

translation: The gods create music, and Huayan says there's a woman in the Āryavatī named Sunkou whose mouth always produces sounds that correspond to a hundred thousand kinds of music, and Zhiyu remembers that women's music is called "whore." source_sentence: 所有眾生眾字本去呼今語便作平聲眾言其多也梵語僕呼善那此翻眾生大乘同性經謂眾生是情想和合義四大界入等會對而生故阿含經謂劫初光音天下生男女尊卑共生故云眾生此約最初說也若攬眾陰而有眾生此據受報說也若言處處受生此約流轉說也至大唐奘法師所譯經論皆稱有情蓋欲簡異無情也然則雖有簡異之言若望上三義則俱失矣。
translation: The word "all beings" (sentient beings) originally goes to the sound of the present language, then it's made plain in the sound of "many" (Sanskrit: servant), which translates as "beings." The Mahāyāna samādhi scriptures say that beings are the result of the interaction of feelings, perceptions, and meanings of the four elements, so the Āgamas say that at the beginning of the eon, the world gives rise to men and women who are noble and inferior, so it's called "beings." This is said to be the first, and if one were to embrace the aggregates and have beings, this is said to be based on karmic retribution, and if one were to say that one is born everywhere, this is said to be based on transmigration.

source_sentence: 以佛神力首楞嚴經云佛住不二法能作神通法華疏云神名不測力名幹用不測則天然之體深幹用則轉變之力大。

source_sentence: 婆羅門天竺姓氏有四婆羅門其一也本行集經佛說偈言清淨無有諂曲心內外正定常安住如是修行諸梵行是名婆羅門種姓維摩疏云婆羅門此翻外意世世相承外學高良之士也又翻淨行是梵天之遠裔其類自云從梵天口生。
translation: There are four Brahman surnames in India, one of which is Brahman. The Sutra of the Collection of Practices states in verse that purity without deceit, correct concentration inside and out, and constant abiding thus cultivating the religious practices are called the Brahman lineage.

source_sentence: 諸龍述異記云水虺五百年化為蛟蛟千年化為龍龍五百年化為角龍又五百年化為應龍廣雅云有鱗曰蛟龍有翼曰應龍有角曰蚪龍無角曰螭龍方言云未能升天曰蟠龍元命包曰龍陰中之陽故舉而雲興括地圖曰龍池之山四方高中有池方七百里羣龍居之說文曰龍鱗蟲之長能幽能明能小能大能長能短春分而登天秋分而入川抱朴子曰有自然之龍有蛇蠋化成之龍佛教者梵語那伽此翻曰龍準須彌藏經龍有五種謂象龍蛇龍馬龍魚龍蝦蟇龍諸經要集云蛇龍乃其本類餘皆旁類故知蛇龍為五龍之長也觀音義疏云龍有四種一守天宮殿龍二興雲致雨龍三決江開瀆龍四守輪王寶藏龍僧祇律云龍有五事苦謂生時眠時淫時瞋時死時一日之中三過皮肉落地熱沙蔟身難陀經云龍有三苦一者雖食百味最後一口化為蝦蟇二者端正采女為夫婦即變為二蛇相交三者背道布鱗沙石生其中痛乃連心起世經說龍通胎卵溼化四生龍王經云龍昔在人中作大福田受大福德不持齋戒受惡苦報而不免金翅鳥難維摩疏云龍是畜生道收正報似蛇依報七寶宮殿與諸天等亦能變形為端正人戒緩乘急聞法悟道。

source_sentence: 阿脩羅正法華稱阿須倫或名阿素洛阿蘇羅皆梵音輕重也婆沙論翻為非天謂此一類雖天道攝而多諂詐無天威德如人行惡名為非人也華嚴音義云阿脩羅此翻形似天舊翻不酒謬也蓋梵語窣利此翻酒而與素羅聲近是故成訛今謂諸文明脩羅既制酒戒不妨義翻當知脩羅不酒有二義一昔持不酒戒二見諸天飲甘露酒即採四天下華置大海中釀酒以魚龍業力酒味不成因此斷酒又翻無端正故長阿含云脩羅生女極端正生男即醜陋是也楞嚴經說胎卵溼化四種脩羅大論明脩羅噉食百味最後一口變作青泥婆沙謂修羅居須彌空缺處或鹹海中輔行云修羅曲心所覆嫉賢忌行。

source_sentence: 迦樓羅此翻金翅鳥靈感傳云翅鳥居鐵圍山舒翼之時三十三萬里毬身之時六千由旬鼓翼一飛即數千里從一鐵圍山巡一大海日食數百龍又食一龍王騰身霄漢數萬由旬下觀壽盡之龍攢身入海海水未合取龍而出觀佛三昧經云翅鳥壽八千歲將死之時諸龍吐毒無由得食從金剛山透海穿地不能過風輪從孔涌出還金剛山如是七反命終火起衝心成如意珠龍得此珠即為王矣華嚴音義云或云揭路茶此翻大嗉項鳥或翻食吐悲苦聲以此鳥凡取龍食先納嗉中然後吐食其龍猶活楚痛出悲苦之聲也。
translation: Garuḍa, which is translated as "garuḍa," according to Lingan's biography, when the garuḍa lives on Mount Tejaprabhā, it spreads its wings for 330,000 li, and when it conches its body for 6,000 yojanas, it puffs its wings and flies for thousands of li, goes from one Mount Tejaprabhā to one ocean, eats hundreds of dragons every day, and eats one dragon king who rises up into the sky for tens of thousands of yojanas.

translation: Mahoraga Vimalakīrti says, "Mahoraga is also known as the pygmy god, or the earthly temple god who accepts human blood and food sacrifices and enters the pygmy's belly because he's lax in morality and therefore falls into the category of ghosts and spirits with much anger.

source_sentence: 一切諸水可知幾滴首楞嚴經云如來發明世間出世間法知其本因隨所緣出乃至恒沙界外一滴之雨亦知頭數。
translation: How many drops of water can be known? The Śūraṃgama-sūtra says that the Tathāgata invents mundane and transmundane dharmas and knows their original causes and follows the conditions that cause them to arise, even up to the number of drops of rain that fall outside the sands of the Ganges realm.

source_sentence: 諸須彌山可知斤兩長阿含云四洲地心即須彌山須彌或言須迷盧此翻玅高四寶所成故言玅出七金山故曰高俱舍云入水皆八萬玅高出亦然言此須彌高八萬由旬入水亦爾也大論云有法可量但力劣不能量耳譬如須彌海水斤兩滴數佛菩薩能知諸天世人所不能知耳漢書律曆志云權者銖兩斤鈞石也所以秤物平施知輕重也本起於黃鍾之重一龠容千二百黍重十二銖兩之為兩二十四銖為兩十六兩為斤三十斤為鈞四鈞為石說文曰八銖為錙二十四銖為兩量字平聲呼謂籌量也。
translation: The Sumeru mountains can be known by the number of pounds and taels.

source_sentence: 一切大地可知塵數大論云佛及法身菩薩能知閻浮提中微塵之數何況恒河沙論又云微塵有大有中有小大者游塵可見中者諸天所見小者聖人天眼所見慧眼觀之則無所有以實性無故婆沙論云微塵至細不可破不可燒本行集經十三卷悉達太子與頞誰那大算師捔試算法乃言一由旬微塵數多少乃至閻浮提縱廣七千由旬如是四洲縱廣由旬有若干微塵乃至大千所有之數皆悉知之文廣不錄須者撿之。

translation: Dharmaguptaka Tiladharaṭṭhita, the king of gods, is also known as the protector of the people. source_sentence: 毗留勒叉天王法華句云毗留勒叉此翻增長謂此王護持國土令佗善根得增長也大論云毗樓勒叉王護持南贍部洲亦兼餘洲住須彌南瑠璃埵領二鬼一名鳩槃茶此翻甕形亦曰形似冬瓜魘魅鬼也一名薜茘多此翻祖父乃餓鬼中劣者陀羅尼雜集云增長天王左手伸臂垂下把刀右手持矟矟根著地現是威勇折伏邪惡令善根增長故以為名靈感傳南山律師一日有天神至房似人行動師問誰耶答曰弟子是南方天王第十五子張津也王有九十一子英略神武各護邦都師言何不現身天曰弟子光色別異驚動眾心共師談論足矣(云云)。
translation: Virūḍhaka, the king of gods, said in the Lotus Sutra that Virūḍhaka, which is translated as "growth," means that this king protects the land so that the good roots of sentient beings can grow. source_sentence: 菩提樹下西域記云菩提樹即畢鉢羅樹也在摩竭陀國尼連河西南十里昔佛在世高數百尺屢經殘伐猶高四五丈佛坐其下成等正覺莖幹黃白枝葉青翠冬夏不凋至佛入滅葉皆凋落須臾還復後有無優王信邪毀佛遺跡興兵翦伐令婆羅門燒以祀天烟焰未靜忽生兩枝次日王妃又遣重伐王祈請又生續有賞迦王再伐其樹掘至泉水不盡根柢後無優王末孫聞而哀感以牛乳溉之經一夜樹生高一丈餘周以石垣高二丈四尺故今此樹隱於石上猶出二丈餘大唐玄奘師經游彼國見菩提樹枯悴唯東向一枝茂發色甚青翠以表大教東傳之俲也。

source_sentence: 金剛座處西域記云昔賢劫初成此座與大地俱起據大千之中下極金輪上侵於地際金剛所成周百餘步奘三藏傳云言金剛座者金剛取其堅固難壞能沮萬物若不依本際則地不能停若不以金剛為座則無地堪發金剛之定大論云土在金輪之上金輪在金剛之上從金剛際出蓮華臺直上持菩薩坐處令不陷沒以故道場名金剛座正理論云四洲之中唯南洲有金剛座以佛佛皆生南洲故晉武帝起居注曰武帝朝燉煌有人來獻金剛寶此寶生金中色如紫石英狀如蕎麥粒唐書曰金剛寶百鍊不銷可以切玉如泥若著山石陷至水際見同類方止。
